Comments_List: Global environmental governance worldviews and problem types
This class was a great introduction to IR theories and the ways in which they apply to various environmental regimes.
Thinking critically about governance systems, policy, etc. Understanding of global governance system.

Strengths: Clear lectures that review the material using examples that help me to grasp the material
Weaknesses: Lecture slides are often dated from past years

Strengths: I liked the balance between theory and practical application of these theories to various environmental treaties and regimes. The feedback on our assignments was always speedy and very thorough. 
Weaknesses: The discussion sections were very helpful, but I think it would have been nice if we had more time for discussion/questions during the lectures as well.

There is a lot of material covered, which isn't a bad thing. However, Ben is not an organized speaker or presenter. So a lot of time was spent untangling threads that didn't need to be tangled in the first place. He doesn't seem to realize that not everyone thinks like him.
Attend the lectures - they are extremely helpful!
This class is a great introduction  for students interested in international environmental governance--I would highly recommend it.
Know that lectures are disorganized and that there is a discussion component.
